Module com.paint.paint
Package com.paint.paint

Class Edit

java.lang.Object
com.paint.paint.Edit
public class Edit extends Object

Edit.java contains the methods for image editing, drawing, etc. Methods from this class will be wrapped in the Controller class.

Since:
1.1.1

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field

    copiedImage
    copiedImage is an Image object storing the current object on the "clipboard"
    static javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D

  • Method Details

    • removeHandlers

      public static void removeHandlers(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)

      This method is used as a concise, one-line, abstract method to remove the event handlers from the active canvas.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the canvas for event handlers to be removed from.
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • updateWidth

      public static void updateWidth(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox widthChoice)

      This method is used in the Controller to update the width of lines drawn by the cursor and by tools.

      Parameters:
      graphContext - the graphics context to be updated.
      widthChoice - the ChoiceBox containing the width options.
      Since:
      1.4.0

    • updateColor

      public static void updateColor(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker colorPicker)

      This method is used in the Controller to update the color of lines drawn by the cursor and tools.

      Parameters:
      graphContext - the graphics context to be updated.
      colorPicker - the ColorPicker object for the selected color to be retrieved from.
      Since:
      1.4.0

    • freeDraw

      public static void freeDraw(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for free drawing on the canvas.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      Since:
      2.2.0

    • drawLine

      public static void drawLine(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for drawing a straight line on the canvas.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      Since:
      2.2.0

      Parameters:

    • drawCircle

    • colorGrabber

      public static void colorGrabber(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup editToggles, javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker colorPicker)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for a color grabber to select a color off of the canvas and write that color into the color picker.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      editToggles - the ToggleGroup that all tools belong to, for selecting free draw after a color is grabbed.
      colorPicker - the ColorPicker that the grabbed color will be written to.
      Since:
      2.2.0

    • eraser

      public static void eraser(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for an eraser tool.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      Since:
      2.2.0

    • select

      public static void select(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for a selection tool. It creates a 2D rectangle drawn by the cursor and stores it in the selection field.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • copy

      public static void copy(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane stack, javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D selection)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for copying the selection area. It configures snapshot parameters to take a snapshot of the entire StackPane within the bounds of the selection rectangle, then takes a snapshot and stores it to the copiedImage field.

      Parameters:
      stack - the StackPane that the active canvas is stacked on.
      selection - the 2D rectangle to be used as snapshot parameters.
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • paste

      public static void paste(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for a paste tool. It draws the copied image on the canvas at the location of the cursor when pressed, adjusted so that the image is drawn with the cursor at the center.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • move

      public static void move(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane stack, javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D selection)

      This is one of many methods used internally within the cursorUpdate method. This particular method configures and adds the event handlers necessary for a move tool. When the mouse is pressed, it first draws a filled rectangle at the location of the selection rectangle. It then draws the copied image on the canvas at the location of the cursor when the mouse is released, giving the illusion that the selection has been picked up and moved.

      Parameters:
      stack - the current StackPane that the active canvas is stacked on.
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      selection - a 2D rectangle object containing the selection area.
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • cursorUpdate

      public static void cursorUpdate(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphContext, javafx.scene.control.ToggleGroup editToggles, javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker colorPicker)

      This method is called by the Controller to update the cursor so that the selected tool is being implemented by the cursor. It calls most of the above functions in a large switch statement to implement this functionality.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the active canvas.
      graphContext - the active graphics context.
      editToggles - the ToggleGroup containing all the tool toggle buttons.
      colorPicker - the ColorPicker used for selecting the color to be used by the tools.
